entry.title: The Immigration (Leave to Remain) (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Immigration (Leave to Remain) (Fees) Regulations 2003 (the “2003 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Contracting-out, Protected Rights and Safeguarded Rights (Transfer Payment) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Protected Rights (Transfer Payment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the Protected Rights Regulations”), the Contracting-out (Transfer and Transfer Payment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the Contracting-out Transfer Regulations”) and the Pension Sharing (Pension Credit Benefit) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000 (“the Pension Credit Benefit Regulations”).

entry.title: The Pensions Regulator Tribunal Rules 2005
entry.summary: These Rules regulate the procedure for references to the Pensions Regulator Tribunal (“the Tribunal”), established under section 102 of the Pensions Act 2004.

entry.title: The Pension Protection Fund (Hybrid Schemes) (Modification) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations modify how the provisions of Part III of the Pensions (Northern Ireland) Order 2005 (“the Order”) operate in relation to hybrid schemes. Part III of the Order makes provision in respect of the Board of the Pension Protection Fund (“the Board”), which is established under section 107 of the Pensions Act 2004 (c. 35).

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Regulations 2005
entry.summary: This instrument contains only provisions in consequence of an order under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (up-rating of benefits). Accordingly, by virtue of paragraph 3 of Schedule 7 to that Act, the Secretary of State has not referred these Regulations to the Social Security Advisory Committee.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Retrial for Serious Offences) Order 2005

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order makes provision corresponding to provisions in the Criminal Appeal Act 1968 (“the 1968 Act”) with modifications for the purposes of applications for retrial under section 76(1) and (2) of the Criminal Justice Act 2003.

entry.title: The Pension Protection Fund (Statement of Investment Principles) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to a statement of investment principles which the Board of the Pension Protection Fund is required to prepare, review and if necessary revise in accordance with section 114 of the Pensions Act 2004 (c. 35).

entry.title: The Gas (Standards of Performance) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These regulations re-enact most of the provisions of the Gas (Standards of Performance) Regulations 2002.

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rating (Alteration of Lists and Appeals) (England) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply to England only, revoke and replace the Non-Domestic Rating (Alteration of Lists and Appeals) Regulations 1993 and the instruments which amended them—

entry.title: The Personal Injuries (Civilians) (Amendment) Scheme 2005
entry.summary: This Scheme further amends the Personal Injuries (Civilians) Scheme 1983 (“the principal Scheme”) which makes provision for the payment of pensions and allowances to or in respect of civilians who were killed or injured during the 1939-45 World War by increasing the amounts of allowances, pensions and awards payable under the principal Scheme and the amounts of income to be disregarded for the purposes of certain parts of the Scheme.

entry.title: The Pension Protection Fund (Maladministration) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the investigation by the Board of the Pension Protection Fund of allegations of maladministration under section 208 of the Pensions Act 2004 (c. 35) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order (Northern Ireland) 2005

ukm:Subject.Subtitle: STATUTORY SICK PAY; EMPLOYMENT; HOUSING; RATES

category.term: STATUTORY MATERNITY PAY; STATUTORY SICK PAY; EMPLOYMENT; HOUSING; RATES

entry.summary: This Order, which corresponds to an Order (S.I. 2005/522) made by the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992, increases the rates and amounts of certain social security benefits and other sums.

entry.title: The Electricity (Standards of Performance) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These regulations revoke and in part re-enact the provisions of the Electricity (Standards of Performance) Regulations 2001. They also introduce a number of changes in the standards of performance arrangements that have been consulted on by the Office of the Gas and Electricity Markets as part of the Electricity Distribution Price Control Review.

entry.title: The Social Security (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Housing Benefit (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 and the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the Income-related Benefits Regulations”). These Regulations also further amend the State Pension Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 (“the State Pension Credit Regulations”).

entry.title: The National Health Service (Pension Scheme and Injury Benefits) Amendment Regulations 2005

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the National Health Service Pension Scheme Regulations 1995 (S.I.1995/300) (“the Pension Scheme Regulations”) and the National Health Service (Injury Benefits) Regulations 1995 (S.I.1995/866) (“the Injury Benefits Regulations”).

entry.title: The Road Transport (Working Time) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations implement the provisions of Council Directive 2002/15/EC concerning the organisation of the working time of persons performing mobile road transport activities.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Pharmaceutical Services) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the National Health Service (Pharmaceutical Services) Regulations 1992 which govern the provision of pharmaceutical services under Part 2 of the National Health Service Act 1977.

entry.title: The Industrial Pollution Control (1997 Order) (Commencement No. 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: This Order repeals, with effect from 3rd April 2005, the Alkali, &c. Works Regulation Act 1906 in so far as not already repealed.

entry.title: The Asylum Support (Interim Provisions) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Asylum Support (Interim Provisions) Regulations 1999.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Stakeholder Products) (Amendment) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Stakeholder Products) Regulations 2004. Regulation 2(2) amends one of the qualifying conditions for a deposit account to be a stakeholder product. Regulation 2(3) makes an amendment consequent on the amended wording in regulation 2(2).
